items.title: 3 Top High-Yield Dividend Stocks I Plan to Buy in March for More Passive Income
items.author: Matt Dilallo
items.description: The author plans to invest in PepsiCo, Johnson & Johnson, and Prologis to generate passive income through their high-yielding and steadily increasing dividends. The companies are well-positioned to continue growing their payouts due to their strong financial profiles and growth prospects.

insights.sentiment_reasoning: PepsiCo has a high dividend yield of 3.5%, more than double the S&P 500 average, and a strong track record of consecutive annual dividend increases, making it an attractive income-generating investment.

Johnson & Johnson has a 3% dividend yield and a long history of dividend growth, supported by its healthy financial profile and ongoing investments in growth, which should enable it to continue increasing its high-yielding dividend.

Prologis, a leading logistics REIT, offers a 3.3% dividend yield and is expected to continue increasing its dividend at a solid pace, driven by growing demand for logistics space and its strong financial position to fund future growth.
